result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas A. Galligan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: with Huber.   IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward any and all outstanding restitution, fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence.
No request for early termination of probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay courts costs.    Pursuant to sec. 973.046(1r), the defendant is required to pay $200.00 DNA surcharge. **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
--------------------

Possess no weapons unless approved by probation agent. 
--------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with Brandon Kraft. No contact with Zachary Debaets. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
--------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed WITH NO VIOLATIONS OF PROBATION, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
--------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
--------------------

timeConds.notes: The defendant is to complete a total of one-hundred (100) hours of community service work during his period of probation with NO BUYOUT OPTION.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas A. Galligan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Failure to Meet Conditions for Expungement
Defendant Thomas A. Galligan in court with attorney Francis P. Raff.   appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Defendant Thomas A. Galligan in court with attorney Francis P. Raff.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH A.B., J.P. OR CO-ACTORS ZACHARY DEBAETS OR LYLE DOWNS OR BRANDON KRAFT.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Thomas A. Galligan appeared, Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
